questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST important for building a robust information security culture within an organization?

choices.B: Security controls embedded within the development and operation of the IT environment
choices.C: Senior management approval of information security policies
choices.A: Mature information security awareness training across the organization
choices.D: Strict enforcement of employee compliance with organizational security policies

comments.content: correct. but not used to build a culture

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I like C - Senior management approval of information security policies. This is stated over and over again in the CISM book, getting leadership buy in. My two cents.

Selected Answer: A
Unclear question. What type of policies the senior management approved? FIrewall? Risk response plan? nooooo... It would be C, if the approval is for business objectives. 
The word culture (governance) is much broader than policies.

Selected Answer: C
No Money, No awareness program, Senior Management Buy In comes first. so C comes before A. A is critical but C is the entry ticket to the game.

Selected Answer: A
i went with C first, but then after a little thinking having policies enforced doesnt promote for a culture, it is training and awareness that does and changes the mindset

Selected Answer: C
Option C

Selected Answer: A
Whilst C certainly has its uses A will have more of an influence over the company culture
A. Mature information security awareness training across the organization

Selected Answer: A
A. Mature information security awareness training across the organization
Having senior management approve policies is not sufficient for building a culture.

Selected Answer: A
Security culture is dependent on employee awareness and acceptance . Not all employee reads and understand policy even when enforced but through training and awareness understanding and abiding with policy becomes easier and practical

Selected Answer: A
Leaning towards A on this one. The issue with C is that it references just the approval for the policies. For management buy in to be effective, it has to be total support of the entire security program, not just a stamp of approval on the policy documents. However, a robust training program fosters a security culture where everyone in the organization understands the importance of security and takes steps to protect the organization's data and systems.

choices.B: Providing training from third-party forensics firms
choices.A: Documenting multiple scenarios for the organization and response steps
choices.D: Conducting tabletop exercises appropriate for the organization
choices.C: Obtaining industry certifications for the response team

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Documentation first, then training, which is based on documentation.

Selected Answer: D
D. Conducting tabletop exercises appropriate for the organization
